intro: Philotria occidentalis, commonly known as the western philotria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often along rocky soils or in desert scrub habitats. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Philotria occidentalis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
